lines.text:
[rhetorically]
Do you not know that in a woman eagerness passes for weakness?
I do not have the words.
Is that why you do not often speak to me?
Yes, yes, I read often in the winter to warm my blood, sometimes in the summer to cool it.

[to Jade]
Remember, my child, that the woman is the root and the man is the tree. The tree grows only as high as the root is strong.

[to restaurant waiter]
Oh, no wine, hunh, and where are your women?
There are other things than wine!
I am neither for or against anything.
What you are not for you are against.

[rhetorically]
How could we conquer a country without its traitors?
How can you dig such a thing without help? The earth is stubborn.
Heaven gave me the thought. Heaven will provide the help. The shovel is there.

[referring to a Japanese officer]
Why do you not defy him?
Alive I can hold my land. Dead I can only hold as much as I am buried in.

[referring to Jade's son]
He has his eyes open. Make sure the one who teaches him has his eyes open.
